body_html:
Apparently, importing the meta_graph causes problems when the name attribute is provided:

File "...", line 80, in freeze #my module
    saver = tf.train.import_meta_graph(input_checkpoint + '.meta', clear_devices=True)
  File "...\tensorflow\python\training\saver.py", line 1909, in import_meta_graph
    **kwargs)
  File "...\tensorflow\python\framework\meta_graph.py", line 770, in import_scoped_meta_graph
    ops.prepend_name_scope(value, scope_to_prepend_to_names))
  File "...\tensorflow\python\framework\ops.py", line 3459, in as_graph_element
    return self._as_graph_element_locked(obj, allow_tensor, allow_operation)
  File "...\tensorflow\python\framework\ops.py", line 3519, in _as_graph_element_locked
    "graph." % repr(name))
KeyError: "The name 'graph_reduction' refers to an Operation not in the graph."

Is there a way to address this?

body:
Apparently, importing the meta_graph causes problems when the name attribute is provided:

```
File "...", line 80, in freeze #my module
    saver = tf.train.import_meta_graph(input_checkpoint + '.meta', clear_devices=True)
  File "...\tensorflow\python\training\saver.py", line 1909, in import_meta_graph
    **kwargs)
  File "...\tensorflow\python\framework\meta_graph.py", line 770, in import_scoped_meta_graph
    ops.prepend_name_scope(value, scope_to_prepend_to_names))
  File "...\tensorflow\python\framework\ops.py", line 3459, in as_graph_element
    return self._as_graph_element_locked(obj, allow_tensor, allow_operation)
  File "...\tensorflow\python\framework\ops.py", line 3519, in _as_graph_element_locked
    "graph." % repr(name))
KeyError: "The name 'graph_reduction' refers to an Operation not in the graph."
```

Is there a way to address this?
